about.title: √úber artUP
about.exhibition_text:
artUP ist eine zeitgen√∂ssische Kunstausstellung mit 18 internationalen K√ºnstlern √ºber verschiedene Medien und Praktiken. Von Street Art bis klassischer Malerei, digitale Kunst bis Installationen ‚Äì artUP feiert die Vielfalt und Vitalit√§t zeitgen√∂ssischen k√ºnstlerischen Ausdrucks.

Diese monatelange Ausstellung im Herzen Speyers schafft eine Plattform f√ºr K√ºnstler, um ihre Werke zu pr√§sentieren und mit der Gemeinde in Dialog zu treten.

about_teaser.title: About artUP
about_teaser.description: An exhibition bringing together 18 international artists across diverse mediums. From street art to classical painting, digital art to installations ‚Äì artUP celebrates contemporary artistic expression.

artists.title: All Artists
artists.description: Discover all 18 participating artists in this year's exhibition.

buja.fullBio: BUJA transforms cityscapes into vibrant dialogues between artist and community. With over a decade in street art, his works challenges perceptions of public space and creative expression.
buja.description: Urban aesthetics meet contemporary expression. BUJA transforms cityscapes into vibrant dialogue.

nina.fullBio: Nina Bussj√§ger brings classical painting techniques into the contemporary realm. Her works explore the intersection of tradition and modernity, creating pieces that speak to both heritage and innovation.
nina.description: Timeless elegance in every brushstroke. Traditional mastery with a contemporary vision.

timothy.shortBio: Pure form and color dancing in space.
timothy.fullBio: Timothy's abstract works strip down to the essence of visual language. Color, form, and composition become vehicles for emotional expression, creating immersive visual experiences.
timothy.description: Pure form and color dancing in space. Abstraction as a language beyond representation.

gizmoh.fullBio: Gizmoh creates visual stories that blur the lines between illustration and fine art. Each piece is a poetic narrative rendered in exquisite detail and imagination.
gizmoh.description: Where illustration meets narrative. Visual stories that whisper and sing.

nikol.fullBio: Nikol captures the complexity of human emotion and connection through figurative painting. Her portraits and figure studies reveal the inner landscape of the human experience.

olga.fullBio: Olga David's artistic practice is distinguished by considerable stylistic and thematic range. Her works merge painting, graphic art, and architectural thinking into a multifaceted expression that goes beyond conventional categories.

monika.fullBio: Monika Schaper works with contrasts: raw materiality meets subtle aesthetics. In her expressive concrete sculptures, tension and movement reveal themselves. Whether concrete, wood, plaster, or metal, each material becomes a vehicle for her distinctive artistic language.

astrid.shortBio: Layering materials, meanings, and textures. Beloved companions
astrid.fullBio: From old newspapers and paste, Astrid Steegm√ºller creates expressive animal sculptures that invite the viewer to touch. Without wire construction, only paper and patience, she models each creature with fine details. What began as fascination has become a daily passion.
astrid.description: Layering materials, meanings, and textures. Beloved companions

joachim.shortBio: Light and shadow as storytellers beyond those moments.
joachim.fullBio: Portraits that tell stories. Of personalities, emotions, dreams, and destinies. This artist's photography captures the depth of human experience. Beyond that, he documents Thai everyday culture with empathetic vision, far from tourist trails. Digital reflections and distortions create surreal worlds, while his own texts unite image and word into a poetic unity.
joachim.description: Light and shadow as storytellers beyond those moments.

klaus.fullBio: Klaus creates monumental sculptures that engage with space and materiality. His work questions the relationship between object, viewer, and environment.

priya.fullBio: Priya's video installations explore temporal experience and embodied perception. Her works create immersive environments that engage all senses.

ahmed.fullBio: Ahmed's practice bridges traditional calligraphy with contemporary art, exploring language as both semantic and aesthetic force.

lucia.shortBio: Body as canvas, action as art.
lucia.fullBio: Lucia's performance practice challenges conventional notions of artistic medium, making the body and its movements central to the work.
lucia.description: Body as canvas, action as art.

david.fullBio: David revitalizes traditional printmaking methods, creating works that honor craft while engaging with current artistic discourse.

isabelle.fullBio: Isabelle transforms entire spaces into immersive artworks, inviting viewers to become participants in the aesthetic experience.

oscar.fullBio: Oscar's ceramic practice celebrates the materiality and imperfection of clay, creating forms that bridge utilitarian and fine art traditions.

mei.fullBio: Mei's textile works weave together cultural narratives and personal histories, creating tactile explorations of identity and belonging.

carlos.fullBio: Carlos brings vibrant energy to public spaces, transforming walls into dynamic canvases that challenge and inspire communities.

about.title: About artUP
about.exhibition_text:
artUP is a contemporary art exhibition bringing together 18 international artists across diverse mediums and practices. From street art to classical painting, digital art to installations ‚Äì artUP celebrates the diversity and vitality of contemporary artistic expression.

Held in the heart of Speyer, this month-long exhibition creates a platform for emerging and established artists to showcase their work and engage with the community.
